job_title: Learning & Development Manager in Exeter, England
cons: We are in a state of growth which is both exciting and challenging.

pros: Great culture. Optimistic about the future and in a state of growth. Talented people in place providing an excellent service.
cons: Covid has made some things more challenging however, the senior team are keen to leverage the learning.
long hours doing the same things

job_title: Digital Content Officer in Exeter, England
pros: Devon Air Ambulance is a much-loved charity in the southwest and for good reason. But it is also a great employer. The leadership listens, cares and is proactive about implementing positive change and keeping in step with the dynamic evolution of the workplace. They absolutely trust their staff to deliver a professional service to the people of Devon and there is no such thing as micro-managing or presenteeism; rather there exists a respect for flexible working and investing in its employees, which is integrated into its fabric. The culture is healthy, supportive and friendly and teams draw together very effectively to help supporters' funds to best achieve its aims.
cons: No cons - I'm very happy here.

job_title: Marketing & Communications Manager in Exeter, England
pros: There truly is a family feel and people genuinely care about each other. The charity is very forward thinking, innovative and believes passionately about training and development for all staff. It's a very open and honest place to work with transparency at the forefront. Staff are encouraged to get involved, share and give ideas.
cons: I have been trying to think of some cons and it's really difficult. Sometimes information about developments isn't passed on quick enough, but this isn't down to being 'secretive', it's just been overlooked or the person dealing is busy. It's not really a con though, but unable to think of anything else to say.

pros: The team are amazing.  Everyone is making a difference and saving lives - doesn't matter what job you do whether actually delivering patient care or part of the team raising the money or ensuring it is properly accounted for.  Meeting patients and their families puts all the hard work in perspective.
cons: I don't have any - wouldn't want to work anywhere else!

job_title: Human Resources Advisor in Exeter, England
pros: Great working atmosphere with lovely people and a real family feel.
